description.p: The shrewd, armored elf stands in the back watching the carnage of battle unfold. Studying the field like a chessboard, she quickly notices gaps in the enemy’s defense. After shouting commands to her allies, her strategic insights lead to victory.

As a hydra threatens adventurers with death, a human clad in plate armor shouts words of encouragement before charging the hydra. Inspired by his bravery, his companions join him in the face of impossible odds.

The opposing army quickly forms a defensive position against the incoming dragonborn batallion. The hulking dragonborn leader steps forward to let out a might draconic roar that sends chills down the defenders’ neck. As the terrifying dragonborn leads his men forward, the defenders flee in terror.

All of these warriors are warlords, excellent leaders in combat. Although all warlords exceed at helping their allies achieve victory, each has a distinct style of leadership. Some prefer to fight alongside their companions to inspire their allies or terrify their foes. Other warlords prefer to never lift a weapon but guide their companions with their sheer presence or words.

A warlord is not a regular combatant. Although trained in fighting, a warlord’s true strength lies with their ability to lead their allies. When choosing to play a warlord, carefully consider your motivations for leadership. Some warlords come from noble lineage and were trained from a young age to be a natural leader. Others might have acquired their skills as an officer or mercenary captain in a military campaign. Perhaps your warlord is a minor warchief seeking glory or a cunning marshal of the borderlands defending the frontier.

All warlords are talented leaders, but their leadership might manifest in different ways. Some warlords might inspire their allies to great heights, while others might terrify their foes to soften them up. Others might prefer more cunning or tactical approaches. Regardless of a warlord’s style, their leadership pushes their allies to become unbeatable. A warlord helps their companions exceed their mortal limits and become legend.

As you build your warlord, think of two points of your character’s background: Where did you get your combat training, and what motivates you to lead others? What is your leadershp style? Are you a charismatic warlord that inspires their allies with your presence? Are you a wise warlord whose experience is invaluable in a fight? Or are you a cunning leader that plays their companions like chess pieces?
These are all viable paths of being a warlord, but you must choose your Leadership Style at level 1. This choice will reflect how your character might act in combat and out of combat.

You can make a warlord quickly by following these suggestions. First, choose your archetype and make your archetype’s Leadership Style attribute your highest ability score. Your next-highest score should be Dexterity or Strength, depending on whether you want to focus on melee weapons or on archery (or finesse weapons). Second, choose the noble or soldier background.
As an warlord, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per warlord level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
Skills: Choose three from Athletics, Deception, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Perception, Persuasion, or Intimidation.

(a) scale mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows

description.p: When you advance in level, and at your DM’s discretion, you may take the option to multiclass into a warlord. You must meet the following prerequisites to qualify for an warlord.
You need a 13 in your chosen warlord archetype’s Leadership Style ability score.
When you first multiclass into warlord, you gain only proficiency in simple weapons, martial weapons, light armor, medium armor, and shields.

setters.set: A martial support class to lead your party to victory.

multiclass.prerequisite: 13 in your chosen warlord archetype’s Leadership Style ability score

description.p: At 1st level, you choose from Commando, Dread Commander, Knight, Tactician, or Arcane Centurion to determine your Leadership Style, which will be referenced in later features. Each of these archetypes are detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 1st level, and again at 3rd level, 6th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level.

At 1st level, your mastery of strategy has taught you to best assist your allies in the heat of battle. You gain two Warlord’s Gambits of your choice. You gambit options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain Warlord levels, you gain additional gambits of your choice, as shown in the Gambits Known column of the Warlord table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the gambits you know and replace it with another gambit that you could learn at that level.
Warlord’s Gambits Unless otherwise specified, you cannot use more than one gambit in place of an attack or in addition to an attack.
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

When you reach 2nd level, you have access to Leadership Points. They represent your ability to give commands to your allies. Your Warlord level determines your number of Leadership Points, as shown on the Leadership Points column of the Warlord table. You regain all of your expended Leadership Points when you finish a short or long rest.

You can spend these points to fuel various features, including your Warlord’s Commands. You can use one of your commands by spending a bonus action and expending a Leadership Point to target a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you.

At higher levels of this class, the range of your commands increase to 40 feet at 5th level, 50 feet at 11th level, and 60 feet at 18th level. You can increase the number of Leadership Points you expend to two points at 5th level, three points at 11th level, and four points at 18th level. You can command one creature for each Leadership Point spent this way. The command must be the same for all creatures.
You know the following three commands:
The targeted creature adds your Warlord’s Dice to their attack rolls before the start of your next turn.
The targeted creature can use their reaction to move up to their movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

The targeted creature regains 1d4 hit points plus your Leadership Style modifier. You can expend additional Leadership Points up to your Leadership Style modifier for the target to heal an additional 1d4 per additional expended Leadership Point.

You can command one creature for each Leadership Point spent. The command must be the same for all creatures. The range of your commands is {{warlords-commands:range}} feet.

Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

At 7th level, when initiative is rolled, choose any friendly creatures within half of your Warlord’s Commands range of yourself. You and chosen creatues gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Leadership Style modifier.

sheet.description: When initiative is rolled, choose any friendly creatures within half of your Warlord’s Commands range of yourself. You and chosen creatues gain a + {{leadership:modifier}} bonus to initiative rolls.

description.p: When you reach 9th level, whenever a friendly creature that can see or hear you makes a skill check, you can spend your reaction to expend a Leadership Point and add your Warlord’s Dice to the roll. You can choose to do this after you see the result of the roll, but before you know the outcome.

sheet.description: Whenever a friendly creature that can see or hear you makes a skill check, you can add 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} to the roll. You can choose to do this after you see the result of the roll, but before you know the outcome.

description.p: At 13th level, you can bolster your an ally’s resolve. When a friendly creature fails a saving throw within your Warlord’s Commands range of you, you can spend your reaction to expend a Leadership Point for the creature to reroll the failed saving throw and add your Warlord’s Dice to the result.

sheet.description: When a friendly creature fails a saving throw within {{warlords-commands:range}} of you, the creature can reroll the failed saving throw and add 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} to the result.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, immediately after initiative is rolled, you can swap the initiative scores of a number of creatures equal to your Leadership Style modifier. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Immediately after initiative is rolled, you can swap the initiative scores of up to {{leadership:modifier}} creatures.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you have two reactions per round.

sheet.description: You have two reactions per round.

description.p: A Commando is a warlord that isn’t afraid to fight dirty and seeks to end a fight before it becomes a battle. Commandos often rely on nimble and decisive tactics to stay one step ahead of their enemies.
At 1st level, you become proficient in your choice of one of the following skills: Nature, Stealth, or Survival.
Starting at 1st level, your Leadership Style is Wisdom. This will affect later features gained by this class.

Also, after initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. The creature can move up to half their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: Your Leadership Style is Wisdom. After initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. The creature can move up to half their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new type of Warlord’s Command: Take Cover. The target of your command can use their reaction to move up to their movement speed and use the Hide action. The creature adds your Warlord’s Dice to the check.

sheet.description: The target of your command can use their reaction to move up to their movement speed and use the Hide action. The creature adds 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} to the check.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: When you reach 6th level, you are a master of covering your tracks. Creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track you and a number of friendly creatures equal to your Leadership Style modifier.

sheet.description: Creatures have disadvantage on Survival checks to track you and up to {{leadership:modifier}} friendly creatures.

description.p: At 10th level, when you see a friendly creature within your Warlord’s Commands range of you attacked, you can spend your reaction to expend a Leadership Point to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. After the attack roll is made, the friendly creature can use their reaction to move up to half their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: When you see a friendly creature within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet of you attacked, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. After the attack roll is made, the friendly creature can use their reaction to move up to half their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

description.p: When you reach 15th level, you and any friendly creatures that start their turn within 30 feet of you gain an extra 10 feet of movement and don’t provoke opportunity attacks. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

sheet.description: You and any friendly creatures that start their turn within 30 feet of you gain an extra 10 feet of movement and don’t provoke opportunity attacks. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

description.p: Starting at 20th level, you can spend your bonus action to target one creature within your Warlord’s Commands range that you can see. When any creature takes the Attack action against the focused target, they can make an additional attack. All attacks score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.
The targeted creature remains focused this way for 1 minute or until they die. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can target one creature within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet that you can see. When any creature takes the Attack action against the focused target, they can make an additional attack. All attacks score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

description.p: A Dread Commander is a fearsome warlord that terrifies foes. These warlords prefer fighting up close to their foes, but unlike Knights, Dread Commanders use intimidation to break their enemy’s resolve and demand victory from their allies.
At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and the Intimidation skill if you don’t already have it.
Starting at 1st level, your Leadership Style is Charisma. This will affect later features gained by this class.

Also, after initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. The creature gains advantage on their next attack roll.

sheet.description: Your Leadership Style is Charisma. After initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. The creature gains advantage on their next attack roll.

description.p: When you reach 3rd level, you gain a new type of Warlord’s Command: Dreadful Threat. The target of your command must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. The DC is equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Leadership Style modifier.

sheet.description: The target of your command must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (save DC {{warlords-command:save-dc}}) or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your proficiency bonus is doubled for Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

At 10th level, when you see a friendly creature within your Warlord’s Commands range of you take damage from an attack, you can spend your reaction to expend a Leadership Point. The ally can spend their reaction to make one weapon attack against the attacking creature. The ally adds your Warlord’s Dice to the damage.

sheet.description: When you see a friendly creature within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet of you take damage from an attack, your ally can spend their reaction to make one weapon attack against the attacking creature. The ally adds 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} to the damage.

description.p: When you reach 15th level, your brutal commands push your allies towards greater violence. When you or a friendly creature within 30 feet of you scores a critical hit with a weapon or reduces a creature to 0 hit points with one, the friendly creature can make one more weapon attack. A creature can only benefit from this feature once per turn.

sheet.description: When you or a friendly creature within 30 feet of you scores a critical hit with a weapon or reduces a creature to 0 hit points with one, the friendly creature can make one more weapon attack. A creature can only benefit from this feature once per turn.

description.p: At 20th level, you can utter a savage battle cry that terrifies your foes and energizes your allies. As an action, choose any creatures that you can see within 60 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. The DC is equal to 8 plus your proficiency modifier plus your Leadership Style modifier. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Also, you and all friendly creatures within 60 feet of you have advantage on attack rolls against frightened creatures for 1 minute.
You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Choose any creatures that you can see within 60 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (save DC {{warlords-command:save-dc}}) or become frightened of you for 1 minute. Also, you and all friendly creatures within 60 feet of you have advantage on attack rolls against frightened creatures for 1 minute.

description.p: A Knight is a courageous warlord that prefers to lead by example. Knights can be found in the thick of combat, inspiring their allies with their selfless bravery.
At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and the Persuasion skill if you don’t already have it.
Starting at 1st level, your Leadership Style is Charisma. This will affect later features gained by this class.

Also, after initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. They gain temporary hit points equal to your Warlord Dice plus your Charisma modifier.
Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new type of Warlord’s Command: Defensive Command. The targeted creature of this command gains the benefit of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: The targeted creature of this command gains the benefit of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.
The targeted creatures of this command gain the benefit of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.

When you reach 10th level, you can encourage an ally to bravely stand against the deadliest of blows. When a friendly creature you can see within your Warlord’s Commands range of you takes damage, you can spend your reaction and expend a Leadership Point to reduce the damage. Roll your Warlord’s Dice four times and reduce the damage by the total amount.

sheet.description: When a friendly creature you can see within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet of you takes damage, you can reduce the damage by 4d{{warlord-dice:die-type}}.

description.p: At 15th level, your commands fill your allies with vigor. When you use your Warlord’s Commands or Warlord’s Strike on a friendly creature, they gain temporary hit points equal to your Warlord’s Dice plus your Leadership Style modifier.

sheet.description: When you use your Warlord’s Commands or Warlord’s Strike on a friendly creature, they gain 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} + {{leadership:modifier}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Starting at 20th level, as an action, you can command your allies to make a final stand. Choose yourself and a number of friendly creatures up to a number equal to your Leadership Style modifier. The chosen creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your warlord level plus your Leadership Style modifier. They can also move their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and make one attack with advantage. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You and up to {{leadership:modifier}} allies gain {{final-stand:temp-hp}} temporary hit points. They can also move their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and make one attack with advantage.

description.p: A Tactician is a warlord that prefers careful preparation and analyzing of the battlefield. When not on the battlefield, Tacticians often study past battles to formulate better strategies for their next fight.
Starting at 1st level, your Leadership Style is Intelligence. This will affect later features gained by this class.
Also, after initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, you can switch your initiative with a friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you.

sheet.description: Your Leadership Style is Intelligence. After initiative is rolled, but before the first turn of combat, you can switch your initiative with a friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you.

description.p: At 1st level, you become proficient in your choice of History or Investigation. Alternatively, you can learn one additional language or tool proficiency of your choice.

Starting at 3rd level, you gain a new type of Warlord’s Command: Strategic Observation. You make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against the targeted creature of this command. The DC is equal to the 10 plus half the creature’s challenge rating (rounded down). If you succeed, you can learn one of the following: the creature’s armor class, strongest saving throw, weakest saving throw, resistances, immunities, or vulnerabilities. The next attack from a friendly creature against the observed creature is made with advantage.

sheet.description: You make an Investigation check against the targeted creature of this command. The DC is equal to the 10 plus half the creature’s challenge rating (rounded down). If you succeed, you can learn one of the following: the creature’s armor class, strongest saving throw, weakest saving throw, resistances, immunities, or vulnerabilities. The next attack from a friendly creature against the observed creature is made with advantage.

description.p: At 6th level, your studies outside of the battlefield have proven effective. You can choose one of your skill proficiencies or tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.
Starting at level 6, you gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws.
When you fail a Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom saving throw, you can spend your reaction and expend a Leadership Point to reroll the failed saving throw.

sheet.description: When you fail a Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom saving throw, you can reroll the failed saving throw.

description.p: When you reach 10th level, when you see a friendly creature within your Warlord’s Commands range of you miss with an attack, you can spend your reaction to expend a Leadership Point for the creature to reroll the attack roll. If the attack hits, the creature can add your Warlord’s Dice to the damage.

sheet.description: When you see a friendly creature within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet of you miss with an attack, the creature can reroll the attack roll. If the attack hits, the creature can add 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} to the damage.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, your keen observations let you predict your foe’s next moves and give your allies an edge. When you successfully use Strategic Observation, choose one of the observed creatures. The targeted creature has disadvantage on all attacks against you and friendly creatures.

At the start your subsequent turns, you must make make a Intelligence (investigation) check contested by the creature’s Charisma (deception) check. If the creature succeeds, then this effect ends. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 1 minute.
You can’t use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you successfully use Strategic Observation, choose one of the observed creatures. The targeted creature has disadvantage on all attacks against you and friendly creatures. At the start your subsequent turns, you must make make a Investigation check contested by the creature’s Deception check. If the creature succeeds, then this effect ends. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 1 minute.

description.p: At 20th level, your battlefield calculations lets you guide your allies to greater effeciency. You can spend your action to choose a number of friendly creatures up to your Leadership Style modifier within 60 feet of you. The chosen creatures can take an extra action on their next turn. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Choose up to {{leadership:modifier}} friendly creatures within 60 feet of you. The chosen creatures can take an extra action on their next turn.

description.p: An Arcane Centurion utilizes arcane power to bolster their allies and devastate their foes. These warlords are as comfortable leading spellcasters as they are commanding mundane warriors.
At 1st level, you gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. Additionally, after a long rest, you can choose one weapon to be your spellcasting focus.

sheet.description: After a long rest, you can choose one weapon to be your spellcasting focus.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your Leadership Style is Intelligence. This will affect later features gained by this class.

Also, after a long rest, choose one friendly creature with the Spellcasting feature. They gain an extra spell slot of their highest level. The spell slot cannot be higher than 5th level. If the spell slot goes unused, it goes away after the next long rest. For Pact Magic, the creature does not regain the extra spell slot after a short rest.

sheet.description: After a long rest, choose one friendly creature with the Spellcasting feature. They gain an extra spell slot of their highest level, up to 5th level. If the spell slot goes unused, it goes away after the next long rest. For Pact Magic, the creature does not regain the extra spell slot after a short rest.

description.p: By 3rd level, you have learned arcane magic through careful studies as a wizard does. See the Player’s Handbook on Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the Arcane Centurion spell list.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: You know three 1st-level wizard spells of your choice, two of which you must choose from the abjuration and conjuration spells on the wizard spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Arcane Centurion Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration or conjuration spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the wizard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an abjuration or conjuration spell, unless you’re replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Arcane Centurion spells, since your magic reflects your arcane studies. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Arcane Centurion spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
See chapter 10 of the Player’s Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting.

Starting at 6th level, when you use your Warlord’s Commands on a friendly creature, it gains a +1 bonus to its armor class and saving throws until the start of your next turn. This bonus increases to +2 at 11th level, and +3 at 18th level.

sheet.description: When you use your Warlord’s Commands on a friendly creature, it gains a +{{shielding-command:ac-bonus}} bonus to its armor class and saving throws until the start of your next turn.

description.p: At 10th level, when you see a friendly creature within your Warlord’s Commands range of you suffer damage, you can spend your reaction and expend a Leadership Point to teleport the friendly creature thirty feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

sheet.description: when you see a friendly creature within {{warlords-commands:range}} of you suffer damage, you can teleport the friendly creature thirty feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

description.p: When you reach 15th level, you emenate a magical warding aura to shield your allies from harmful magic. You and all friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against magical effects. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

sheet.description: You and all friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against magical effects. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

description.p: At 20th level, you can teleport your allies to surround an enemy you can see. You can expend your action to choose yourself and a number of friendly creatures up to your Leadership Style modifier within your Warlord’s Commands range of you. You teleport all chosen creatures 120 feet to unoccupied spaces. You and the chosen creatures can all make one attack or cast one cantrip. Each attack or cantrip deals additional 4d6 force damage.
You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You and up to {{leadership:modifier}} friendly creatures within {{warlords-commands:range}} feet of you can teleport 120 feet to unoccupied spaces. You and the chosen creatures can all make one attack or cast one cantrip. Each attack or cantrip deals additional 4d6 force damage.

description.p: Your aggresive lunge leaves you open to an enemy’s counterattack, making you difficult to ignore. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature has disadvantage on its next attack roll that doesn’t target you until the start of your next turn.
When you reach 11th level of this class, the creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn’t target you until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature has disadvantage on its next attack roll that doesn’t target you until the start of your next turn.
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn’t target you until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Your well aimed strike leaves the enemy vulnerable to your ally’s follow up attack. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can mark the creature until the start of your next turn. The next, successful attack against the marked target from a friendly creature deals extra damage equal to your Warlord’s Dice plus your Leadership Style modifier.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can mark the creature until the start of your next turn. The next, successful attack against the marked target from a friendly creature deals 1d{{warlord-dice:die-type}} + {{leadership:modifier}} extra damage.

description.p: Forgoing offense, you use your weapon, shield, or both to block any harm to your ally. In place of making an attack, choose a friendly creature that is within 5 feet of you. Until the the start of your next turn, the first attack against that friendly creature is made with disadvantage as long as the friendly creature stays within 5 feet of you.
When you reach 11th level of this class, all attacks against the friendly creature are made with disadvantage until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: In place of making an attack, choose a friendly creature that is within 5 feet of you. Until the the start of your next turn, the first attack against that friendly creature is made with disadvantage as long as the friendly creature stays within 5 feet of you.

In place of making an attack, choose a friendly creature that is within 5 feet of you. Until the the start of your next turn, any attack against that friendly creature is made with disadvantage as long as the friendly creature stays within 5 feet of you.

description.p: Realizing your ally is in a better position, you encourage them to go on the offensive. In place of making an attack, choose a friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. If the creature takes the Attack action on their next turn, they can make one more additional weapon attack. A creature can only gain one additional attack from this feature.
When you reach higher levels of this class, the range of Guided Strike increases with the range of your Warlord’s Commands.

description.p: Shouting words of encouragement, your attack not only hurts the enemy but inspires your ally. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Warlord’s Dice.
When you reach higher levels of this class, the range of inspiring a friendly creature increases with the range of the your Warlord’s Commands.
